description: A precision-based vertical platformer inspired by Super Mario's classic jump physics.
rationale: This game focuses on the core mechanic of platformers: jump timing and horizontal control. It is designed for reinforcement learning agents to master momentum and collision detection in a dynamic environment.
details: The game features a Mario-like character that must jump upwards through a series of procedurally generated platforms. Platforms have varying widths and move horizontally at higher difficulty levels. The gravity and jump velocity are modeled after 8-bit classics. The screen scrolls upward as the player ascends, and falling below the bottom of the screen results in a game over. Power-ups like a 'Super Mushroom' occasionally appear to increase the jump height for a single leap.
how_to_play: Goal: Reach the highest altitude possible. Controls: Use LEFT and RIGHT arrow keys to move horizontally in mid-air. Press SPACE or UP to jump. Score: +10 points for every new platform reached. Penalties: Falling off the bottom of the screen ends the session.
